subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Spindles and Fact Memory
description: Learn Sleep Spindles and Fact Memory in one minute.

hook.text: A burst of brain activity lasting half a second happens hundreds of times each night. It's filing your facts.

buildup.text: Sleep spindles are rhythmic neural bursts generated by the thalamus during N2 sleep.

discovery.text: They coordinate the transfer of declarative memories, like facts and events, from temporary to permanent storage.

twist.text: People who produce more spindles after studying perform better on memory tests the next day.

climax.text: Spindle density varies between individuals and is partly genetic, which may partly explain memory differences.

punchline.text: More spindles tonight means better memory tomorrow.

quiz.question: What type of memory do sleep spindles primarily consolidate?
options: Declarative memories like facts and events
